Relative Motion.docstring:
Calculates the relative velocity of object A with respect to object B in one dimension.

Parameters:
    velocity_A (float): The velocity of object A (v_A) in m/s.
    velocity_B (float): The velocity of object B (v_B) in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The relative velocity of A with respect to B (v_AB) in m/s.
Relative Motion.python_code:
def calculate_relative_velocity_1d(velocity_A: float, velocity_B: float) -> float:
    return velocity_A - velocity_B

Relative Motion.docstring:
Calculates the relative acceleration of object A with respect to object B in one dimension.

Parameters:
    acceleration_A (float): The acceleration of object A (a_A) in m/s^2.
    acceleration_B (float): The acceleration of object B (a_B) in m/s^2.

Returns:
    float: The relative acceleration of A with respect to B (a_AB) in m/s^2.
Relative Motion.python_code:
def calculate_relative_acceleration_1d(acceleration_A: float, acceleration_B: float) -> float:
    return acceleration_A - acceleration_B

Relative Motion.docstring:
Calculates the relative position of object B with respect to object A in one dimension.

Parameters:
    position_B (float): The position of object B (x_B) in meters (m).
    position_A (float): The position of object A (x_A) in meters (m).

Returns:
    float: The relative position of B with respect to A (x_BA) in meters (m).
Relative Motion.python_code:
def calculate_relative_position_1d(position_B: float, position_A: float) -> float:
    return position_B - position_A

Relative Motion.docstring:
Calculates the net speed of a boat/swimmer (v_m) crossing a river for the shortest time. This assumes the swimmer swims perpendicular to the river flow (v_mR).

Parameters:
    velocity_swimmer_relative_river (float): The speed of the swimmer relative to the river (v_mR) in m/s.
    velocity_river (float): The speed of the river (v_R) in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The net speed of the swimmer (v_m) relative to the bank in m/s.

Calculates the net speed of a boat/swimmer (v_y) for the shortest path (straight across). Assumes v_mR > v_R.

Parameters:
    velocity_swimmer_relative_river (float): The speed of the swimmer relative to the river (v_mR) in m/s.
    velocity_river (float): The speed of the river (v_R) in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The net speed of the swimmer (v_y) perpendicular to the bank in m/s.

Calculates the time taken for a boat/swimmer to cross a river along the shortest path (straight across). Assumes v_mR > v_R.

Parameters:
    river_width (float): The width of the river (d) in meters (m).
    velocity_swimmer_relative_river (float): The speed of the swimmer relative to the river (v_mR) in m/s.
    velocity_river (float): The speed of the river (v_R) in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The time (t) to cross the river in seconds (s).

Calculates the angle (θ) upstream a boat/swimmer must aim to travel the shortest path (straight across). Assumes v_mR > v_R.

Parameters:
    velocity_swimmer_relative_river (float): The speed of the swimmer relative to the river (v_mR) in m/s.
    velocity_river (float): The speed of the river (v_R) in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The angle (θ) upstream from the perpendicular, in degrees.

Calculates the magnitude of the relative velocity of rain (v_Rm) w.r.t. a person (m). This formula assumes the rain (v_R) and person (v_m) are moving perpendicularly.

Parameters:
    velocity_rain (float): The speed of the rain (v_R), typically vertical, in m/s.
    velocity_man (float): The speed of the man (v_m), typically horizontal, in m/s.

Returns:
    float: The relative speed of the rain as perceived by the man (v_Rm) in m/s.
